rounds.category: GREATER THAN, LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO

clues.text: One statute mile is equal to this number of feet
On the pH scale anything that ranks less than 7 is considered this
In geometry this type of angle is greater than 90 degrees but less than 180
Introduced by Einstein in 1905, it's been called "the most famous equation in the world"
By definition negative numbers are ones that are this, also the title of a novel & film
"Be our guest, be our guest, put our service to the test"
"You're welcome! For the tides, the sun, the sky... you're welcome! I'm just an ordinary demi-guy"
"When hearts are high, the time will fly, so whistle while you work" (& put those dishes in the tub, woodland animals!)
"I'm in the mood to help you, dude, you ain't never had a friend like me"
"De Bogotá hasta palenque me fui con toda la gente"
Brazil's emperor Pedro II was on hand when he demonstrated his telephone at the Philadelphia exhibition in 1876
He escaped on a British ship, leaving John André to be hanged; unpopular in America & Britain, he'd die in London in 1801
In 1895 this Black educator said, "We can be as separate as the fingers, yet one as the hand in all things essential to mutual progress"
Starting in 1758 Francis Lightfoot Lee served in this assembly in Colonial Virginia
Did he sell the item that is his first name in his Georgia mercantile store? No idea, but he did sign the Declaration of Independence
In a 1697 play Colley Cibber wrote that this "is eleven points in the law"
In 1966 The Bobby Fuller Four sang, "I'm breakin' rocks in the hot sun, I fought the law &" this happened
Kipling called "the laws of" this place "many and mighty"
Named for an aerospace engineer, it says that if something can go wrong, it will
This Supreme Court justice known as the "Great Dissenter" said, "Great cases, like hard cases, make bad law"

Hoof
(6 letters)

(10 letters)

Passer-by
(9 letters)

Appendix
(10 letters, none of them X)
Usually copper, it can physically protect a structure & metaphorically describe someone used to divert an attack from another
A French courtier wrote that this American "snatched the lightning shaft from heaven and the scepter from tyrants"
If you want to catch lightning on a bottle, shop for this sports drink created in 1965
A party of 2, these are Santa's 2 reindeer whose names mean "thunder" & "lightning"
"Spark Ranger" Roy Sullivan got zapped at Shenandoah Natl. Park in this "colorful" mountain range; over time, Roy took 6 more hits
Words that rhyme in this poem include bore, shore, implore, Lenore & door, & there is at least one "-more"
Xanadu, your neon lights will shine for you as the location of this ruler's "stately pleasure-dome"
It's kind of a shame Lewis Carroll is not alive to rewrite this piece & rhyme "bandersnatch" with "Cumberbatch"
Whitman got tired of this somewhat cheesy 1865 elegy for Lincoln & wrote another, "When Lilacs Last in the Dooryard Bloom'd"
Ginsberg "saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness" in this primal scream of a poem
Founded in 1972 by Time Inc., the company known by these 3 letters set cable on fire with "The Sopranos" & "Sex & the City"
Playing himself in "J.C.V.D.", this international superstar kicked around in Belgium
The initials in the movie & TV title "M*A*S*H" stood for this, where they worked
It's faster to say these 3 letters than Maya Arulpragasam, whose stage name honors a cousin who disappeared
Ryan Reynolds & Jeff Bridges starred in this film, playing lawmen dispensing justice from beyond the grave
The Avon & Cheddar Gorges
Part of a trio, the Wu & Qutang
Todra Gorge in the High Atlas
Aare Gorge
Olduvai Gorge

rounds.comments: (Ken: The most popular in 2022, according to the Social Security Administration.)

clues.text: Maybe acting is in the future for kids with this name, No. 1 for females; at least it was for Ms. Colman & Ms. Wilde
Maybe acting is in the future for kids with this name, No. 1 for males; at least it was for Mr. Hemsworth & Mr. Cunningham
It was No. 2 for males, or should we say, "there went in two and two unto" this name "as God had commanded"
No. 7 for girls, this 3-letter palindromic name will be one of the first called alphabetically when roll is taken
This No. 2 name on the list for baby girls was the No. 1 name for Jane Austen in an 1815 novel
The scholarly feats of the Brothers Grimm include compiling this type of reference work, the. "Deutsches Wörterbuch"
This company acquired the rights to the British board game Cluedo & renamed it Clue in 1949
This 1954 musical centers on a septet of backwoods siblings intent on finding mates
These brothers bought James A. Bailey's business in 1907
This outlaw band of siblings including Grat, Bob & Emmett were cousins of the cutthroat Younger brothers
When it comes to electricity in our homes, the AC in AC/DC stands for this
In college John Legend was a director of this kind of singing group without musical accompaniment
One of these with hidden pictures or treats typically begins on December 1 & helps kids count down to Christmas
The Gerald R. Ford one of these cost $13 billion to build & is more than 3 football fields long
Shirley Temple sang about these in her "soup, monkeys & rabbits loop the loop"

rounds.text: In February 1793 the French were repulsed in an attack on this island from one just north that they controlled
